tool.name: StyleTerrainAwareLayer

param.name: style_type
param.expression: CMYK_DOTS | DOT_LINES | HACHURES | HALFTONE_DOTS | HATCHING | STIPPLE | SWISS-ISH | LINES | WATERCOLOUR | WEIGHTED_CONTOURS
param.dialogReference:
Defines the artistic cartographic style to be applied to the input features. Keep in mind these are just starting points, feel free to experiment with them or make your own.

Some styles utilize the terrain polygons, other make use of the terrain aware contours.
param.pythonReference:
Defines the artistic cartographic style to be applied to the input features. Keep in mind these are just starting points, feel free to experiment with them or make your own.

Some styles utilize the terrain polygons, other make use of the terrain aware contours.

param.name: in_features
param.pythonReference: The input features to be styled.

param.name: map_scale
param.dialogReference:
Define the map scale at which you intend to author your map. Since the styles render differently based on scale (they respect screen measures and not spatial measures) setting an intended scale will help to configure the arcade expressions that render the style. This method isn't fool-proof so some additional tweaking may be required.

*All styles were developed and configured at a scale of 1:24,000. Some interpolation was used to convert the arcade expressions to the desired scale. Buckle up.

** You can always configure the styled expressions later to fine tune and then set a reference scale on your map.
param.pythonReference:
Define the map scale at which you intend to author your map. Since the styles render differently based on scale (they respect screen measures and not spatial measures) setting an intended scale will help to configure the arcade expressions that render the style. This method isn't fool-proof so some additional tweaking may be required.

*All styles were developed and configured at a scale of 1:24,000. Some interpolation was used to convert the arcade expressions to the desired scale. Buckle up.

** You can always configure the styled expressions later to fine tune and then set a reference scale on your map.

tool.summary: Styles the outputs of the 'Create Terrain Aware Layers' tool with a set of compiled styles. These styles are a starting point and can be further configured.
